New Records: The Thunder extended their winning streak to 15 games.
Key Match Events: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander finished with 33 points, 11 rebounds, and six assists on 11-for-23 shooting.
Lu Dort hit three triples in the final two and a half minutes to seal the deal.
A late third-quarter run was jumpstarted by a corner triple from guard Lu Dort, followed by a late shot-clock layup from Gilgeous-Alexander after a string of offensive rebounds.
Pre-Game Insights: There's a short list of teams atop the NBA that appear to be capable of competing with OKC and Boston is one of them.
Post-Match Reflections: The Thunder have another tough battle in its next game, taking on the Cleveland Cavaliers at 6:00 p.m. CT on Jan. 8 on the road.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The high-intensity defense and physicality on that end made hitting shots from the perimeter challenging for both teams.
OKC shot 16-for-38 from the perimeter and Boston 9-for-46.
Others: Guard Aaron Wiggins saw valuable minutes and, in turn, was a volume scorer for Oklahoma City, ending the first half with 10 points and finishing with 15 when the buzzer sounded.
